Description: Bracelet: composed of twenty-nine rectangular strips of mother-of-pearl, bored with a hole at the top and bottom. Three of the plaques are broken.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Bracelets of mother-of-pearl plaques are mentioned by Petrie in ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), 46. and illustrated on pl.XL, bottom left, but there is no specific mention of this particular example.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (639)
